text: but this is really sort of the first
evidence to date of the president trying
to influence the investigation the most
important thing is that the president is
not supposed to try and influence or
impede any type of FBI investigation and
in this case he went to the FBI director
and said you know my national security
adviser Mike Flynn did nothing wrong and
you guys need to move on from this
look I've been spending a lot of time
over the past few days trying to
understand what went on between mr.
Comey and mr. Trump and trying to
understand what it was that mr. Trump
didn't like about mr. Comey and what was
it about mr. Trump that really concerned
mr. Comey and in the process of that I
learned that there was a series of memos
that that Comey had written about every
single interaction that he had had with
Trump because Comey was so concerned
about what Trump may try and do to the
FBI and he described in detail how mr.
Trump tried to influence him and tried
to say to him hey you really need to
drop this investigation and Comey put a
lot of detail in these memos the
question is is that Republicans open to
this point have really resisted calls
for a special prosecutor they have said
there's no need for that the Justice
Department can handle this the question
now is whether the disclosure that Trump
tried to influence Comey
is enough to get the Republicans to say
okay we need for there to be a special

because that will prevent the president
